page.title: 07ST. Michaels,Childs Ercall
page.content: {Childs Ercall church was in the {Domesday book of 1086.}The church has got a hole, this hole is called a hagioscope or squint, it was put there so that people from the south door can see the priest and the Altar, you don't often see a hagioscope because most of them have been covered up or filled in. In the church there are three bells one of the bells is possibly original whilst two were re_cast, one in 1620 and one in 1868. There was some extensive work done on the tower in 1984 following an examination of the construction when a pinnacle on top broke. The vicar has two parishes; St. Peters Stoke_on_Tern and st. Michaels Childs Ercall. Childs Ercall has a choir but not Stoke_on_Tern but Stoke_on_Tern has got a sunday school Childs Ercall has not.
